verses.text: After these things Paul departed from Athens , and came to Corinth ;
And found a certain Jew named Aquila , born in Pontus , lately come from Italy , with his wife Priscilla ; (because that Claudius had commanded all Jews to depart from Rome :) and came unto them.
And because he was of the same craft , he abode with them , and wrought : for by their occupation they were tentmakers.
And he reasoned in the synagogue every sabbath , and persuaded the Jews and the Greeks.
And when Silas and Timotheus were come from Macedonia , Paul was pressed in the spirit , and testified to the Jews \add that\add* Jesus \add was\add* Christ.

And when they opposed themselves , and blasphemed , he shook \add his\add* raiment , and said unto them , Your blood \add be\add* upon your own heads ; I \add am\add* clean : from henceforth I will go unto the Gentiles. \p
¶ And he departed thence , and entered into a certain \add man’s\add* house , named Justus , \add one\add* that worshipped God , whose house joined hard to the synagogue.
And Crispus , the chief ruler of the synagogue , believed on the Lord with all his house ; and many of the Corinthians hearing believed , and were baptized.

Then spake the Lord to Paul in the night by a vision , \wj \+w Be|strong="G5399"\+w* \+w not|strong="G3361"\+w* \+w afraid|strong="G5399"\+w*, \+w but|strong="G0235"\+w* \+w speak|strong="G2980"\+w*, \+w and|strong="G2532"\+w* \+w hold|strong="G4623"\+w* \+w not|strong="G3361"\+w* \+w thy peace|strong="G4623"\+w*:\wj*

\wj \+w For|strong="G1360"\+w* \+w I|strong="G1473"\+w* \+w am|strong="G1510"\+w* \+w with|strong="G3326"\+w* \+w thee|strong="G4675"\+w*, \+w and|strong="G2532"\+w* \+w no man|strong="G3762"\+w* \+w shall set|strong="G2007"\+w* \+w on thee|strong="G4671"\+w* \+w to hurt|strong="G2559"\+w* \+w thee|strong="G4571"\+w*: \+w for|strong="G1360"\+w* \+w I|strong="G3427"\+w* \+w have|strong="G2076"\+w* \+w much|strong="G4183"\+w* \+w people|strong="G2992"\+w* \+w in|strong="G1722"\+w* \+w this|strong="G3778"\+w* \+w city|strong="G4172"\+w*.\wj*
And he continued \add there\add* a year and six months , teaching the word of God among them. \p
¶ And when Gallio was the deputy of Achaia , the Jews made insurrection with one accord against Paul , and brought him to the judgment seat ,
Saying , This \add fellow\add* persuadeth men to worship God contrary to the law.

And when Paul was now about to open \add his\add* mouth , Gallio said unto the Jews , If it were a matter of wrong or wicked lewdness , O \add ye\add* Jews , reason would that I should bear with you :
But if it be a question of words and names , and \add of\add* your law , look ye \add to it\add*; for I will be no judge of such \add matters\add*.
And he drave them from the judgment seat.
Then all the Greeks took Sosthenes , the chief ruler of the synagogue , and beat \add him\add* before the judgment seat. And Gallio cared for none of those things. \p

¶ And Paul \add after this\add* tarried \add there\add* yet a good while , and then took his leave of the brethren , and sailed thence into Syria , and with him Priscilla and Aquila ; having shorn \add his\add* head in Cenchrea : for he had a vow.
And he came to Ephesus , and left them there : but he himself entered into the synagogue , and reasoned with the Jews.
When they desired \add him\add* to tarry longer time with them , he consented not ;
But bade them farewell , saying , I must by all means keep this feast that cometh in Jerusalem : but I will return again unto you , if God will. And he sailed from Ephesus.
And when he had landed at Cæsarea , and gone up , and saluted the church , he went down to Antioch.
And after he had spent some time \add there\add*, he departed , and went over \add all\add* the country of Galatia and Phrygia in order , strengthening all the disciples. \p
¶ And a certain Jew named Apollos , born at Alexandria , an eloquent man , \add and\add* mighty in the scriptures , came to Ephesus.
This man was instructed in the way of the Lord ; and being fervent in the spirit , he spake and taught diligently the things of the Lord , knowing only the baptism of John.
And he began to speak boldly in the synagogue : whom when Aquila and Priscilla had heard , they took him unto \add them\add*, and expounded unto him the way of God more perfectly.
And when he was disposed to pass into Achaia , the brethren wrote , exhorting the disciples to receive him : who , when he was come , helped them much which had believed through grace :
For he mightily convinced the Jews , \add and that\add* publickly , shewing by the scriptures that Jesus was Christ.
